New Records: Virat Kohli became the highest run-getter in T20 World Cups.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored 66 not out off 44 balls.
KL Rahul's direct hit run out of Litton Das was a turning point.
Arshdeep Singh delivered excellent yorkers at the death.
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib Al Hasan chose to bowl first because his team was not sure what a good score on the pitch would be.
Rohit Sharma said he would have batted first anyway because runs on the board always matter.
Soumya Sarkar was out for Bangladesh, and Shoriful Islam was included.
Axar Patel came into the side in place of Deepak Hooda for India.
Post-Match Reflections: Nurul Hasan did his best to perform a miracle, but his 25 off 14 was not enough.
India secured a hard-fought five-run victory, taking them to the top of Group 2.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted and curtailed the match, reducing it to 16 overs per side.
The field was likely to be greasy following the downpour, affecting play.
